comments:
Eclipse M8
CDT 2.0.0.200403291152

Test case:
1. Create a managed make project, call it MgdCpp.
2. Add a file to MgdCpp, call it main.cpp.
3. Insert the following code into main.cpp:

	
	class CMyClass {
		public:
			CMyClass() {};
	};
	
	int
	main(int argc, char **argv) {
		CMyClass mc;  // ** (A) **
	}
4. Right click on the "mc" token on line (A).

Result:  The followin exception is generated in the .log file:

My example seems a little flaky as it seems to fail sporadically...

A better test case is using the Open Declaration feature on a blank line; that
seems to consistently generate the error.

I'll keep an eye on the other test case...

Fixed in head as of 14/05/04.
